page.title: 03ECOLOGY CONTINUED
page.content: The ecology is a result of poor soils derived from{Bunter Sandstone} resulting in coarse,sandy,light textured,free draining soil,poor in nutrients, earthworms,bacteria and susceptible to drought.The average{ {rainfall}is less than{635 mm per year} as Edwinstowe is in the rain shadow of the Pennines.South-West winds are most common followed by cool Northern winds and the average {January Temperature {is 3deg.C}and in{July 61deg.C.. { Oak trees}offer a rich source of insects which attract{Woodpeckers and {Tits.Acorns}attract{Jays}and{Wood {Pigeons.Rabbits}find the sandstone easy to burrow in.{Fallow and Red Deer appreciate the mixed forest and heathland.The{Red Deer}are on the verge of extinction.{Fallow Deer}are common,{Muntjac and Roe Deer}are rare. {Foxes}are common,{Badgers}are rare.
